The `{ino}` R package provides tools for analyzing the initialization of numerical optimization. For detailed examples and usage instructions, please refer to the [package vignettes](https://loelschlaeger.de/ino/articles/).

## Installation

You can install the released version from [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

```{r, install released, eval = FALSE}
install.packages("ino")
```

## Example

The [Ackley function](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ackley_function) has multiple local minima and one global minimum in the origin. We define the numerical optimization problem, including an optimization algorithm and initial values:

```{r, ackley def, message = FALSE}
library("ino")
Nop_ackley <- Nop$new(f = TestFunctions::TF_ackley, npar = 2)$
  set_optimizer(optimizeR::Optimizer$new(which = "stats::nlm"))$
  initialize_random(runs = 100)
```

We can visualize the surface and the initial values:

```{r, ackley plot, message = FALSE}
ggplot2::autoplot(Nop_ackley)
```

The optimization result depends on the initial value:

```{r, ackley opt, message = FALSE}
Nop_ackley$
  optimize()$
  optima(digits = 2)
```
